snippet: Lance Armstrong was central to a sprawling doping program, officials said, yet he used both cunning and farcical methods to beat his sport’s drug-testing system.
abstract: United States Anti-Doping Agency report on Lance Armstrong describes in great detail how the world's greatest cyclist and his team eluded doping tests; report also introduces new scientific evidence that suggest Armstrong was doping the last two times he competed in the Tour de France.
lead_paragraph: Lance Armstrong was central to a sprawling doping program, officials said, yet he used both cunning and farcical methods to beat his sport’s drug-testing system.
